title: Budget Flights to Hyderabad - The Lion City
text:
Travel Articles | October 19, 2015 
Hyderabad means the ''city of lion''. Hyderabad is the capital city of southern Indian state Andhra Pradesh and also the largest city of Andhra Pradesh. 
Anyone haven’t been everywhere but it must be on everyone’s list and make our dreams come alive we have to make a start. So to being the list there are numerous states and cities to roam in the world. Hyderabad is one of the most visited cities of India and also an ideal destination to start the world voyage list. 
Hyderabad is the capital city of the Indian state of Telangana and also the legal capital of Andhra Pradesh, situated on the banks of Musi River, covering an area of around 625 square kilometers. With a population of around 7.75 million, it is the fourth largest city of India in terms of population. 
Climate of Hyderabad 
As per its location on the banks of Musi River at the northern part of Deccan Plateau, the city features a semi-arid pleasant climate. The winter season in Hyderabad starts from the month of November and lasts till February, then summer season stays from March to the month of May followed by monsoon season starting in June and lasts in month of September. October is assumed as the post monsoon season. 
Etymon of Hyderabad 
Hyderabad is Hyder’s abode in which hyder means lion and abode means city together it forms the lion city. There are several theories related to name of the city as it was suggested that Muhammad QuliQutb Shah, the founder of city named it as Baghnagar after Baghmati, the dancing girl whom he loves and later she converted to Islam and changed her name to HyderMahal therefore the city had further renamed as Hyderabad. The son of QuliQutb Shah- Haider is also believed to be the origin to the name of city. 
Best Time to visit 
The period from November to February that is the winter season is the best time to visit Hyderabad as there are intolerable climate during summer season and in monsoon also the city is likely to receive raining cats and dogs and mighty strong winds which can spoil a pleasant trip. So, do plan your trip in winter season and enjoy the pleasant climate of the lion city – Hyderabad.
